title: The tryals and condemnation of Thomas White alias Whitebread, provincial of the Jesuits in England, William Harcourt, pretended rector of ]ondon, John Fenwick,procurator for the Jesuits in England, John Gavan alias Gawen, and Anthony Turner, all Jesuits and priests; for high treason: in conspiring the death of the King, the subversion of the government, and Protestant religion. At the Sessions in the Old-Bailey for London and Middlesex, on Friday and Saturday, being the 13th and 14th of June, 1679. Published by authority.
author: Whitbread, Thomas, 1618-1679, defendant.
notes: James Corker was also a defendant in this trial. Cf. p. 3.
The words "Thomas .. Turner," are gathered by a left brace on the title page.
With an advertisement at end of text.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
